io.cloudboost

Class CloudFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.cloudboost.CloudFile

  • public class CloudFile
extends Object

    Title: Abstract wrapper for File objects

    CloudFile is an object that represents an arbitrary file format, can save and retrieve these from CloudBoost

    Author:
    cloudboost

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CloudFile(Blob fileObj)
      Constructor that builds CloudFile Object from a Blob
      CloudFile(File fileObj)
      Constructor that builds a CloudFile object from File and tries to guess the mimetype
      CloudFile(File fileObj, String contentType)
      Constructor that builds a CloudFile object from File and content type of the file
      CloudFile(JSONObject jsonObject) 
      CloudFile(String url)
      A Constructor that takes the URL of a file and downloads it to create a CloudFile Object
      CloudFile(String fileName, Object data, String type)
      Constructor that builds a CloudFile object out of arbitrary data

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void delete(CloudStringCallback callbackObject)
      deletes a saved CloudFile
      void fetch(CloudFileArrayCallback callback)
      fetches this file from the database
      io.cloudboost.ACL getAcl()
      returns the ACL object representing the access rights on this file
      JSONObject getDocument()
      returns the raw JSONObject wrapped by this class, only make direct changes to the underlying JSONObject if you absolutely know what you are doing
      void getFileContent(ObjectCallback callback)
      returns the file content as an object
      String getFileName()
      returns the name of the file
      int getFileSize()
      Returns the size of the file in Bytes
      String getFileType()
      returns the mime type of the file as a {@link java.lang.String)
      String getFileUrl()
      returns the URL of the file as saved in cloudboost, unsaved files have no URL's
      String getId()
      returns the Id assigned to this file after saving, an unsaved CloudFile object has no Id
      void save(CloudFileCallback callbackObject)
      Makes an HTTP POST request to upload the file and save all attributes to CloudBoost
      void setAcl(io.cloudboost.ACL acl)
      replaces the existing ACL object
      void setDocument(JSONObject document) 
      void setFileName(String name)
      Gives the file a name as should be saved in CloudBoost
      void setFileType(String type)
      Changes the type of the file to the given String

                 Object data,
